explanation: Agent A's report is correct in substance. calculate_nonce has several parameters declared as pointers-to-const (e.g. const struct sockaddr_storage *saddr, const char *rnd, const char *uri, const char *realm) which are passed to digest_update. If digest_update is prototyped as digest_update(struct DigestAlgorithm *da, void *data, size_t size) (i.e. non-const second parameter), those calls would discard the const qualifier and therefore violate the intent of MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 (pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible). If, however, digest_update is declared to accept a const void * (digest_update(struct DigestAlgorithm *da, const void *data, size_t size)) then no const-qualification is discarded and there is no violation. In short: the reported violation is conditional on the digest_update prototype — the report is correct when digest_update's data parameter is non-const.
